    • Constructor Detail

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.Integer id,
       java.lang.Double[] v)
        Default constructor to create a Network.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique ID of this Network.
        v - the correct/ideal/target values that are used to train the network.

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.Integer id,
       org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.AbstractRealDistribution d,
       java.lang.Integer inNodes,
       java.lang.Integer lNodes,
       java.lang.Integer outNodes,
       java.lang.Integer numEdges,
       java.lang.Integer l,
       java.lang.Double r,
       java.lang.Double s,
       java.lang.Double[] v)
        Constructor to create a Network with the given parameters using the default 3-dimensional space.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique ID of this Network.
        d - the statistical distribution drawn from to determine neurons' initial values and firing thresholds.
        inNodes - the number of input neurons.
        lNodes - the number of neurons in each hidden layer.
        outNodes - the number of output neurons.
        numEdges - the number of synapses.
        l - the the number of layers.
        r - the the learning rate used for reinforcement in backpropagation.
        s - the scaling (or dampening) factor used to modulate the learning rate as backpropagation takes place.
        v - the correct/ideal/target values that are used to train the network.

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.Integer id,
       org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.AbstractRealDistribution d,
       java.lang.Integer inNodes,
       java.lang.Integer lNodes,
       java.lang.Integer outNodes,
       java.lang.Integer numEdges,
       java.lang.Integer l,
       java.lang.Double r,
       java.lang.Double s,
       java.lang.Double[] v,
       java.lang.Integer length,
       java.lang.Integer width,
       java.lang.Integer height)
        Constructor to create a Network with the given parameters using the given 3-dimensional space.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique ID of this Network.
        d - the statistical distribution drawn from to determine neurons' initial values and firing thresholds.
        inNodes - the number of input neurons.
        lNodes - the number of neurons in each hidden layer.
        outNodes - the number of output neurons.
        numEdges - the number of synapses.
        l - the the number of layers.
        r - the the learning rate used for reinforcement in backpropagation.
        s - the scaling (or dampening) factor used to modulate the learning rate as backpropagation takes place.
        v - the correct/ideal/target values that are used to train the network.
        length - the number of available locations in the x dimension (or points along the x-axis) where the Network may place a Node.
        width - the number of available locations in the y dimension (or points along the y-axis) where the Network may place a Node.
        height - the number of available locations in the z dimension (or points along the z-axis) where the Network may place a Node.

      • Network

        public Network(java.lang.Integer i,
       org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.AbstractRealDistribution d,
       java.lang.Integer inNodes,
       java.lang.Integer lNodes,
       java.lang.Integer outNodes,
       java.lang.Integer numEdges,
       java.lang.Integer l,
       java.lang.Double r,
       java.lang.Double s,
       java.lang.Double[] v,
       javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gui)
        Constructor to create a Network with the given parameters using the default 3-dimensional.
        Parameters:
        i - the unique ID of this Network.
        d - the statistical distribution drawn from to determine neurons' initial values and firing thresholds.
        inNodes - the number of input neurons.
        lNodes - the number of neurons in each hidden layer.
        outNodes - the number of output neurons.
        numEdges - the number of synapses.
        l - the the number of layers.
        r - the the learning rate used for reinforcement in backpropagation.
        s - the scaling (or dampening) factor used to modulate the learning rate as backpropagation takes place.
        v - the correct/ideal/target values that are used to train the network.

    • Method Detail

      • simulate

        public void simulate(int rounds,
            boolean learning)
        Simulate the behavior of the Network.
        Parameters:
        rounds - the number of iterations to run before reporting the Network's state.
        learning - whether or not learning through backpropagation should be enabled after reach round is run.

      • learn

        public Edge[] learn(Edge[] oldLayer,
           java.lang.Double[] targetValues,
           java.lang.Double scale)
        Update a single given old layer/functional unit based on feedback from the change in performance at predicting given target values.
        Returns:
        the improved layer/functional unit after learning by adjusting weight according to sigmoid of performance.

      • backpropagate

        public void backpropagate()
        Send scaled feedback throughout the neural network for learning, beginning from the output layer/functional unit and ending at the initial input layer/functional unit.
